item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Bankruptcy takes out two
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility, your hub for all things “future of transportation.”

item.title: Waymo suspends service in San Francisco as robotaxis stall during blackout
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

item.title: As EU waters down 2035 EV goals, electric startups express concern
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: The future may be electric, but that future is being postponed. The European Commission, citing the need for flexibility, has softened its ambitious plan to ban the sale of gas-powered cars by 2035. Instead of requiring 100% of new cars to be zero-emission vehicles by that date, the revised plan would allow 10% of new […]

item.title: Israel’s famed VC Jon Medved, diagnosed with ALS, backed the tech that will improve his life
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In perhaps the last public interview of one Israel's most famous VCs, Jon Medved tells TechCrunch how tech will enhance his life.

item.title: Google and Apple reportedly warn employees on visas to avoid international travel
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Law firms representing Google and Apple have reportedly warned that employees who need a visa stamp to re-enter the United States should avoid leaving the country due to longer-than-usual visa processing times.

item.title: ‘It felt so wrong’: Colin Angle on iRobot, the FTC, and the Amazon deal that never was
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The iRobot founder opens up about the 18-month regulatory process that he says doomed the Roomba maker -- and what it means for American innovation.

item.title: OpenAI allows users to directly adjust ChatGPT’s enthusiasm level
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: ChatGPT users can now tweak the chatbot’s warmth, enthusiasm, and emoji use.

item.title: New York Governor Kathy Hochul signs RAISE Act to regulate AI safety
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The bill will require large AI developers to publish information about their safety protocols and report safety incidents to the state within 72 hours.

item.title: Sequoia partner spreads debunked Brown shooting theory, testing new leadership
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The newest episode raises questions about whether Sequoia's new leadership -- managing partners Alfred Lin and Pat Grady, who took over last month -- can or will rein in Maguire's social media activity.

item.title: Ex-Splunk execs’ startup Resolve AI hits $1 billion valuation with Series A
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners, according to people familiar with the deal.

item.title: Rocket Lab wins another defense-related space contract
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The $816 million contract follows a separate $515 million — both awarded by the U.S. Space Development Agency.

item.title: Building venture-backable companies in heavily regulated spaces
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen, Maggie Nye
item.description: This week on Build Mode, Startup Battlefield editor Isabelle Johannessen spoke to two founders who are working to make progress in industries ripe for disruption, despite the regulatory headaches that might have deterred many other people.

item.title: Former Patagonia CEO Rose Marcario resigns from Rivian’s board
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Marcario joined the board in 2021, and will maintain her position as chair overseeing the Rivian Foundation, which made its first grants last year.

item.title: Where are investors placing their bets next year? AI, AI, AI.
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Investors at TechCrunch Disrupt explained their focus on artificial intelligence and offered advice to founders on how to stand out in a crowded AI field.

item.title: Cursor continues acquisition spree with Graphite deal
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Graphite is an AI code review assistant that was last valued at $290 million.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $56B Tesla pay package restored by Delaware Supreme Court
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The decision brings to a close a years-long court battle that irked Musk so much he moved Tesla's incorporation from Delaware to Texas.

item.title: Anonymous messaging app NGL was acquired by ‘EarnPhone’ startup Mode Mobile
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Given NGL's track record of dubious growth hacking, this partnership with Mode Mobile seems like a good match.

item.title: Hundreds of Cisco customers are vulnerable to new Chinese hacking campaign, researchers say
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Cisco warned that Chinese government hackers are exploiting a zero-day in some of its products. Researchers now say there are hundreds of vulnerable Cisco customers.

item.title: Yann LeCun confirms his new ‘world model’ startup, reportedly seeks $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Renowned AI scientist Yann LeCun confirmed on Thursday the worst-kept secret in the tech world: that he had indeed launched a new startup. Although he did say he will not be running the new company as its CEO.

item.title: Netflix is betting on podcasts to become the new daytime talk show
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Netflix is making exclusive deals with podcast studios to compete with YouTube, but podcasters have mixed feelings.
